page.title: 15ESCOMB COUNTY JUNIOR SCHOOL
page.content: The school was built in about 1862 as two separate schools, for juniors and for juniors and seniors, - an all age Primary School. In 1964 the seniors were transferred to Vinovium School and the two schools were amalgamated under one headteacher. In February 1967 all pupils were moved into Witton Park so that alterations could be made and two extra classrooms, a hall, kitchen, staffrooms and toilets added. Witton Park was then closed and all children transferred to Escomb school in September 1968, housed together in a listed building School. The catchment area of the school is Escomb, Witton Park, Etherley Grange, Etherley Dene and Greenfield Dene. About 120 pupils are on the role, a head and five class teachers, four part-time teachers, an auxiliary, five domestic staff and two assistants.
